section.title: Introduction
section.p: A common use case for Barcode4J is generating barcodes in SVG format for XSL-FO documents.

section.title: Several possibilities
section.p: There are two main possibilities for generating barcode in an XSL-FO environment using Barcode4J.

ol.li: generate a barcode in SVG format during the XSLT stage

ul.li: If you're using the Apache Xalan-J XSLT Processor you can use the Xalan extension.
If you're using the SAXON XSLT Processor from Michael Kay you can use the SAXON extension.

ol.li: generate a barcode during XSL-FO processing

ul.li: If you work with Apache FOP, using the FOP extension will be the most attractive option.

section.p: If you don't find a matching solution for your environment, drop us a mail on the barcode4j-users mailing list.
